about_the_game:
A roguelite turn based strategy game, where your units move autonomously after you set them in motion, such that you have to rely on the turns of the magic cube.

Sounds crazy? Well, it is.

Every Run is Different

Fight through a series of procedurally generated cubes before you exceed the number of allowed rotations, crushing tough bosses like Aranthos, or Tasanzang, who broke a holy oath thrice, and was forgiven twice, until you may fight Xuhivan the Godless himself, to only fail or succeed on this cubic battlefield, what does it matter really?

Luckily, you are not bound to winning square: Use relics to your advantage, turn the time back or make a pact with the old gods in Overworld Events. Yet, beware: Not all that glinters is brass, and some choices will cost you more dearly than just the time you payed...

Mythic Lore

Command the Guardian of Love, the leader of the cannibals who now inhibit the once proud city of Naan, Chiron the Dragonslayer, Lung the traveling monk, that lizard born without wings declared bastard by his family, infamous for their ingenious poetry, Drunk Demons of Sand, Phoenixes, Swamp Dragons and many more.

Break the Game or Get Broken

Rotate the cube smartly to make your enemies drown, blow them of the edge of the cube, or burn everything to the ground until nothing of them remains. But indeed, the squares are ruthless, and having your enemies spawned two tiles off may lead to drastically different outcomes, and the fire that you intended to unleash on your enemies may burn your very hand.

All litigations based on bite marks in your keyboard are exempt.

Other Features

  • Unlock new units, relics and events after every run
  • Strange and bizzare handcrafted overworld
  • Cutscenes
  • Generally we hope its a decent game
  • And many more

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel i5-8500 @ 3.00 GHz
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 2060
  • DirectX: Version 10
  • Storage: 8 GB available space
  • Additional Notes: These requirements are from the PC this game is tested on. Much worse PCs will do.

short_description: A roguelite turn based brain twister on a fully functioning magic cube, where allies and enemies move deterministically without your command, requiring you to wisely choose fighters with bizzare fates and relics of extraordinary power.
